step_of_the_day.title:
Letting go of negativity and supporting your foundation. Overcoming criticism from others, or yourself
            (Pillars #1 & 2)
step_of_the_day.content:
It is easy to be impacted by criticism, real or imagined. It can hurt. It can stop you in your tracks. It
            can intimidate you. But most importantly, it can undermine and get in the way of reaching your goals. Part
            of the impact of judgements is how they touch into your own insecurities and your own self-judgement. It’s
            important not to be a victim of others or your own negative comments.

action_step:
To combat the fear of negative judgements, it’s important to find and establish a healthy place to ground
            yourself. I’m referring to an internal center that is loving and accepting, or what I’ve been referring to
            as your “Healthy Internal Parent\" (HIP). No one is perfect and we all make mistakes. When you anchor
            yourself to a healthy internal voice, reminding you that you are “OK\", that is accepting of you and
            compassionate, you can overcome the negativity. But first you must remember to decide that it doesn’t
            support you to listen to or believe the criticism. So, today, when you hear or imagine judgements from
            others or hear it from your own inner voice, make sure to label it as inappropriate and destructive. Then
            shift into the healthy voice where you are now anchoring yourself, and give yourself these positive
            messages. Remember “neurons that fire together, wire together.\"
journal_entry: Write about your efforts to shift from the negative to the positive perspective inside yourself.
